text: Flag of the Voivodeship The flag of Podlaskie Voivodeship is a symbol of the Podlaskie Voivodeship, Poland. The flag was adopted by Resolution No. LIV/448/02 of the Sejmik of Podlaskie Voivodeship on 30 August 2002. The flag panel of the Podlaskie Voivodeship is rectangular in shape with the proportions of 5:8 and consists of four horizontal stripes, equal in width in the following colors, successively from the top: white, red, yellow, and blue. The upper white stripe refers to the Eagle and the Chase; red, gold and blue also symbolize different colors from the coat of arms of the voivodeship. == Official colors == From CMYK * white - 0,0,0,0 * red - 0,100,100,0 * yellow - 0,0,100,0 * blue - 100,30,0,0 ==See also== * Flag of Poland * Coat of arms of Poland ==References== Flag Category:Flags of Poland
title: Flag of the Podlaskie Voivodeship
